intro: Polychilos taenialis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed polychilos, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in umbel-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
